definitions.name: Supply Chain Optimization
definitions.description: Comprehensive analysis of supply chain processes, bottlenecks, and optimization opportunities.

definitions.name: Market Demand Forecast
definitions.description: Statistical and AI-driven forecasting of market demand patterns for strategic planning.

definitions.name: Risk Assessment Matrix
definitions.description: Quantitative and qualitative risk analysis framework for business decision making.

definitions.name: Financial Impact Analysis
definitions.description: Analysis of financial implications and ROI for strategic initiatives.

feedback.message: The supply chain analysis feature is very helpful, but could use more granular filtering options.
Great tool overall! The AI analysis is very accurate and saves a lot of time.
Having issues with the chat streaming functionality on large datasets.

tables.name: supply_chain_data
tables.description: Raw supply chain metrics and KPIs

tables.name: market_demand_history
tables.description: Historical market demand data for forecasting

messages.content: Can you analyze our Q1 supply chain performance?

I'll analyze your Q1 supply chain data. Based on the current metrics, I've identified three key bottlenecks: 1) Supplier lead times averaging 18 days vs target of 12 days, 2) Inventory turnover ratio below optimal at 6.2x, and 3) Transportation costs up 15% due to route inefficiencies.
Can you analyze our Q1 supply chain performance?

Based on historical data and market trends, the RTX 4090 demand forecast for Q2 2024 shows: Week 1-4: 15,000 units, Week 5-8: 18,500 units, Week 9-12: 22,000 units. This represents a 23% increase over Q1, driven by gaming market recovery and AI workload adoption.

messages.title: Response from bot
messages.content: Thank you for your message. I am a virtual assistant specialized in data analysis, supply chain optimization, and market analysis. How can I help you today?

messages.title: Response from bot
messages.content:
# Talk to Your Supply Chain — Demo Markdown

> Scenario: “Why did **On-Time In-Full (OTIF)** drop in **LATAM** last week, and what should we do before the holiday surge?”

## Goals
- Explain the OTIF dip with clear evidence (suppliers, lanes, SKUs).
- Recommend fast, low-risk mitigations.
- Produce a shareable summary for Ops & Finance.

## Filters (Action Filters)
- **Date range:** 2025-07-15 → 2025-08-12  
- **Region:** LATAM  
- **SKU family:** Compute Nodes (A100/H100)  
- **Carrier:** All  
- **Warehouse:** Bogotá DC-01

## Executive KPIs (Today vs 7-day)
| Metric                 | Today | 7-day Avg | WoW   | Target | Status |
|------------------------|------:|----------:|:-----:|------:|:------:|
| **OTIF**               | 88.4% | 91.1%     |  ↓    | ≥95%  | ⚠️     |
| **Fill Rate**          | 96.2% | 97.0%     |  ↓    | ≥98%  | ⚠️     |
| **Lead Time (avg)**    | 9.8d  | 9.1d      |  ↑    | ≤8d   | ⚠️     |
| **Backorders (units)** | 312   | 250       |  ↑    |  0    | 🔺     |

## Where the drop happened
- **Lane:** GDL → BOG shows **+2.1d** transit delay (port congestion spillover).
- **Supplier:** Foxtron-MX short on **power rails** for H100 trays (**−3,200 pcs**).
- **SKU impact:** H100 trays > A100 add-on kits (priority skew).

## Top Stockouts (rolling 7 days)
| SKU                 | DC     | Units | Lost Rev. (USD) |
|---------------------|--------|------:|----------------:|
| H100-TRAY-PWR-KIT   | BOG-01 |   120 |        864,000  |
| A100-RAILS-SET      | BOG-01 |   210 |        231,000  |
| H100-CABLE-PCIE     | LIM-02 |    80 |         72,000  |

## Risks & Alerts
- ⚠️ **Supplier constraint** on power rails persists 2–3 weeks.
- 🚢 **Ocean dwell** +0.8d (TEUs for GDL origin).
- 🧊 **Cold start** carriers on BOG last-mile underperforming (SLA breach 6%).

## Recommendation (Prioritized)
1. **Expedite critical rails** (partial air-freight; limit to H100 trays; cost cap ≤ $12k).  
2. **Rebalance inventory** from LIM-02 → BOG-01 (transfer window 48–72h).  
3. **Temporary carrier swap** for BOG last-mile lanes with SLA bonus/malus.  
4. **Issue supplier PO split** (weekly cadence; smaller lots) until constraint clears.

## Streaming sample (what the app displays progressively)

**Request (JSON)**
```json
{
  "query": "Explain the OTIF drop in LATAM and propose mitigations.",
  "filters": {
    "date_from": "2025-07-15",
    "date_to": "2025-08-12",
    "region": "LATAM",
    "sku_family": "Compute Nodes"
  },
  "request_id": "8f9a7b9e-6c2a-4b4a-9a1b-5a0c7c8b12a4"
}
```

**SSE/NDJSON Chunk (example)**
```json
{ "type": "delta", "content": "OTIF fell to ", "request_id": "8f9a7..." }
```
```json
{ "type": "delta", "content": "88.4% due to supplier constraints ", "request_id": "8f9a7..." }
```
```json
{ "type": "complete", "tokens": 412, "elapsed_ms": 3180, "request_id": "8f9a7..." }
```

## Quick Visual
![LATAM lane map (placeholder)](https://placehold.co/820x260?text=LATAM+Lanes+%26+Delays)

## Action Checklist
- [x] Validate filters (date range + region).
- [x] Confirm supplier shortage on rails with Foxtron-MX.
- [ ] Approve partial air-freight budget.
- [ ] Execute DC transfer LIM-02 → BOG-01.
- [ ] Monitor OTIF daily for 2 weeks.

## Notes
- External links: [Next.js](https://nextjs.org) · [NVIDIA Developer](https://developer.nvidia.com)  
- Data sources used: WMS, TMS, Supplier ASN feeds, Port dwell API.  
- If OTIF stays **<90%** for 3 consecutive days, escalate to **Tier-1 incident**.



[SHOW_CHART:1f079e2c-d603-6711-aef8-f0435b8b67bb]

messages.title: Response from bot
messages.content: LATAM OTIF dropped to 88.4% due to supplier constraints and lane delays. Actions: 1) Air-freight rails (cap ≤ $12k), 2) Rebalance LIM-02 → BOG-01, 3) Temporary carrier swap. Monitor OTIF daily; escalate if <90% for 3 days.

- [x] Confirm supplier shortage on rails with Foxtron-MX.
- [ ] Approve partial air-freight budget.
- [ ] Execute DC transfer LIM-02 → BOG-01.
- [ ] Monitor OTIF daily for 2 weeks.

codeSnippet.title: Supply Chain Analysis Script
codeSnippet.code:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from datetime import datetime

# Load supply chain data
df = pd.read_csv('supply_chain_data.csv')

# Calculate lead time statistics
lead_time_avg = df['lead_time'].mean()
lead_time_std = df['lead_time'].std()

# Identify bottlenecks
bottlenecks = df[df['lead_time'] > lead_time_avg + lead_time_std]

print(f'Average lead time: {lead_time_avg:.1f} days')
print(f'Bottleneck suppliers: {len(bottlenecks)}')

chart.title: Supply Chain Lead Time Analysis
chart.headline: Lead Time Performance by Supplier
chart.preamble: Analysis of supplier lead times reveals significant variations across our supplier base.
chart.narrative: The analysis shows that 3 out of 15 suppliers are exceeding our target lead time of 12 days, with Supplier B showing the highest deviation at 21 days. However, Supplier B also maintains the highest quality score, suggesting a trade-off between speed and quality.
